alert.note: Alert for Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 1:52PM MDT until April 14 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS LEAD TO CHANCES FOR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THURSDAY TO MIDNIGHT MDT THURSDAY NIGHT AND 2 PM FRIDAY TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 111, 112, AND 113... * WIND... Southwest winds of 20 to 25 mph with gusts of 35 mph on Thursday. West winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 mph on Friday. * HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity values from 7 to 15 percent during strongest winds. * HIGHEST THREAT...is located along and west of the Rio Grande Valley on Thursday and east of the Rio Grande Valley on Friday. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands
